description: Ms. codex. Title from lower and upper edges; the full title is not completely legible. Physical description: 21 lines per page; written in naskh in black on thin, glazed, laid Arabic paper. Rubrication and catchwords; marginal notes. Outer margin damp-stained; leaves 1-48 detached. Origin: Rabīʻ II 1115 H [August-September 1703], by ʻAlī Aṣghar ibn Muḥammad Bāqir al-Iṣfahānī (leaf 236b). Incipit: الحمد لله ... اما بعد فيقول ... خليل بن الغازي القزويني ... ان اکثر طلبة العلم من اهل زماننا قد رغبوا عن کتب اصول الفقه
author: Qazwīnī, Khalīl ibn al-Ghāzī, 1592 or 1593-1678 or 1679
abstract: Gloss on the work of Muḥammad ibn al-Ḥasan al-Ṭūsī.
extent: 242 leaves : paper ; 243 x 128 (166 x 78) mm bound to 245 x 131 mm
title: Ḥāshiyat ʻUddah
provenance: Owner's note and stamp on leaf 1a; owner's stamp on leaf 242b.
creator: قزويني، خليل بن الغازي، 1592 or 1593-1678 or 1679
subject: Ṭūsī, Muḥammad ibn al-Ḥasan, 995-1067?—ʻUddat al-uṣūl.
binding note: Limp black leather with marbled paper doublures.
member of collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
